column4: Anyone knows a good performance testing tool for mediaplayers?
May I inquire why?
Its my project, i have to check performance of video rendering process w.r.t graphics library
I have to check which library gives better performance
Ah, sounds complicated. Personally, I would use only Mplayer, and set it to run at full speed over the multiple libraries with the audio off.
And time the results.
Making sure dropping frames was turned off.
I wanted to go through gnome-mplayer
And problem is there is no benchmark option in gnome-mplayer
ok. I'm very doubtful any benchmarking software exists for that purpose.
What you're asking is very weird, because a library may be able to run fast, but what good is that if the media is very lightly compressed? There appears to be too many factors.
can you please tell me why we turn off dropping frames?
Because dropping frames causes certain parts of the video to be completely skipped.
ok
For example, I have the same media in two formats. Same video, but first format is 10MB, second format is 100MB. Which would you guess is going to run faster?
Even if they are both 10MB, one could be lower quality than the other, making a huge difference.
I'm not saying it isn't a noble thing to try and benchmark though. I just think that you may be in over your head with this project.
ok i am bit confused regarding my project.. but any how i have to report performance of different libraries.
No offense, but I would select another project. I do not think you are going to get results of any value from gnome-mplayer.
Acknowledging that you don't know what frame-dropping is, I personally think your experience in this area is much too low.
yes i am new to this area since i am a student i need to learn a lot
Anyways thanks for your suggestions..
Yeah, I'm sorry I couldn't give you better news. :\
